fungui

Class Timer

  • java.lang.Object
    • fungui.Timer

  • public class Timer
extends java.lang.Object
    The Timer class acts like the traditional kitchen timer. You give it an amount of time in milliseconds, and it will go "off" at some time x that you assign it, except it doesn't have a buzzer. It merely helps time some GUI events, and may be the basis for an actual timer graphical interface in the future.
    Author:
    Audrey Seo

    • Constructor Detail

      • Timer

        public Timer(int end,
             processing.core.PApplet p)
        First constructor for the Timer class.
        Parameters:
        end - int, the amount of time to set the timer to in milliseconds.
        p - PApplet parent, usually "this."

      • Timer

        public Timer(processing.core.PApplet p)
        Second constructor for the Timer class.
        Parameters:
        p - PApplet parent, usually "this."

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the timer back to the beginning, using the amount of time in milliseconds that was input with the Timer(int end, PApplet p) constructor.

      • reset

        public void reset(int n)
        Starts the timer all over again. Resets the time when it is done to a given integer.
        Parameters:
        n - int, the amount of time to set the timer to in milliseconds.

      • done

        public boolean done()
        Gives the status of the timer. It returns a boolean based on the amount of time passed.
        Returns:
        boolean, true if the amount of time has expired, and false if there is still time left to go.

      • timeLeft

        public int timeLeft()
        Notifies the user of the amount of time remaining before the timer is done. If the time has already elapsed, it returns 0.
        Returns:
        int, the amount of time in milliseconds left before the time runs out.
